p: A. occidentale revealed high antioxidant activity through DPPH radical scavenging, ferric thiocyanate, and thiobarbituric acid assays. However, it did not exhibit nitric oxide (NO) inhibitory activity ( 40, 147). Good antioxidant capacity of red and yellow cashew was also observed using 2,2'-azino-bis(3-ethylbenzothiazoline-6-sulfonic acid) (ABTS) and DPPH radical scavenging assays ( 148). Moreover, Kongkachuichai et al. ( 149) reported that young cashew leaves demonstrate high antioxidant capacity by oxygen radical absorbance capacity (ORAC) and FRAP assays.
